result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert Lee Stahowiak was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: of Sentencing after Revocation held on November 14, 2017, before Hon Mark T. Slate - Circuit Court Judge, by Brenda L. Sosinsky - Court Reporter

1:22 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty William Lennon.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Lennon.  Atty Lennon has received a copy of the revocation packet, with no corrections, additions or deletions.  State has received a copy of the revocation packet, with no corrections, additions or deletions.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA Christenson.  Sentencing statement by Atty Lennon.  Statement by defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

 18 months of Initial Confinement and 2 years of Extended Supervision.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:

Court costs of $618.00.  If not paid, it can be converted to a civil judgment and collected by any means necessary.
Defendant is to abide by all rules of extended supervision.

Court finds the defendant eligible for the CIP & SAP programs.
Court orders the sentence to commence immediately.
Court grants the defendant 61 days of sentence credit.

Court adjourned at 1:33 p.m.

from Atty William Lennon dated November 10, 2017 re: request for adjournment due to agent not sharing revocation order and the whereabouts of defendant  (NOTE:  Called Atty Lennon and informed him the revocation order and warrant is filed and he has access and the defendant is in the Green Lake County Jail.  Atty Lennon to advise if adjournment is still requested.
By Atty William Lennon

records.addlTxt:
10:50 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Jeanne Zamzow.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Zamzow - has received a modification to the offer and defendant will accept, but has not filled out a plea questionnaire.  Court adjourns to later. 

Court adjourned at 10:51 a.m.

Court reconvened at 11:08 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Jeanne Zamzow.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 1 as charged, with probation and counts 2 & 3 will be dismissed and read-in.  State concurs.  Atty Zamzow concurs.  Defendant concurs.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged.  Court orders counts 2 & 3 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Zamzow.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 2 1/2 years.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.
-Domestic Abuse Counseling and any follow-up
-Defendant is to report to his agent any relationship that he may begin or be in
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

No objection to probation being transferred to Winnebago county.

Court adjourned at 11:17 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 30, 2016 at 10:30 am.

9:57 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Jeanne Zamzow.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Zamzow - have not had the opportunity to check in with the DA before court in regards to conditional jail time.  Court sets for Plea & Sentencing on August 30, 2016 at 10:30 a.m. 

Court adjourned at 9:59 a.m .
Status hearing on August 23, 2016 at 09:30 am.

2:24 P.M.  Defendant present in court with Atty Jeanne Zamzow.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Zamzow - was not able to talk with the District Attorney.  Court sets for Status Hearing on August 23, 2016 at 9:30 a.m. 

Court adjourned at 2:25 p.m.
Status hearing on July 5, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

10:56 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Jeanne Zamzow.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Zamzow - have reviewed the offer with the defendant and need one more hearing.  Court sets for Status Hearing on July 5, 2016 at 1:30 p.m. 

Court adjourned at 10:58 a.m.
Status hearing on June 21, 2016 at 10:30 am.

10:13 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Jeanne Zamzow.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Zamzow - have an offer and sent to defendant, and defendant did not receive it.  Court sets for Status Hearing on June 21, 2016 at 10:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 10:14 a.m.
Defendant's
State's
Status hearing on May 17, 2016 at 10:00 am.

11:11 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Jeanne Zamzow.  Andrew Christensonn for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Zamzow - defendant will waive the preliminary hearing.  Defendant concurs.

Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary examination.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files an information with the court.  Attorney Zamzow and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty Zamzow enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Court sets for Status Hearing on May 17, 2016 at 10:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 11:13 a.m.
